utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, good morning.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is %uh tour guide one and %uh my name is Lynnette.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Hello Lynnette, I'm participant number twenty one.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: My name is Ria.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm planning to visit Singapore this coming vacation.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh can you please tell some highlights about Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um when do you plan to come in to Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm planning to visit there %uh this mid-April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And is there any particular interest %uh or anything that you like to see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I'm planning to go there with my child.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you please tell something a place where we can enjoy our vacation there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how many days will you be spending here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: About %uh two days.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your child is below twelve?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh %um eight years old.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what do you- what the both of you like to do?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I want to spend the vacation with my child %um. %Um any amusement centre or %um places like parks that we can go there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, sure.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes %uh-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: okay %uh will you be staying in a hotel?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What could be-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And how the- yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How %um- can you please %uh give me some list of hotels so- where we can stay for %um cheapest price.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I only have %uh one thousand dollar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Cheapest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh cheapest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, we have like different category of hotels-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So they range from budget hotels, backpackers %uh to of course %uh five-star hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so when you say cheapest %uh maybe- I have actually flashed on the screen-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh less then hundred to hundred and forty nine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this kind of pricing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe can you give me a price range?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe %uh could be a do- %uh a hundred dollar per day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is that- is it possi-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A hundred dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, is it possible to have a hundred dollar %uh for a day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes, it is still quite possible.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh slightly above hundred, would that be alright with you?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um about %uh the custom there in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh is there any local custom do I need to keep in mind?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh %uh meaning the dress code or behaviour.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: A dress code or- and %um if- I mean the public places, what something do I need in- to remember where I'm- where in my stay- %uh I'm staying there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For dress code %uh we dress quite casual out here unless you are going to a fine dining place.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um a dress or dress pants for the lady is fine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no slipper for fine dining %uh or restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you don't need to wear gowns

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: or cocktail dresses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for %uh normal behaviour %uh we do not encourage littering %uh anywhere in the public area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um about in entering in Singapore, do I need a visa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh not for Filipinos.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And aside from shopping or %uh what else you can recommend to me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, for your child.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: When I'm- alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well I would recommend that you can- okay, I have actually- maybe you just go back a little bit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just now you were asking me about your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, on my list here, I given you some of the rates %uh for the hotel which is along your price range.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so if you look down %uh the screen, I have here %uh Hotel Bencoolen.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is in actually the price range of %uh hundred and %uh a hundred and ten.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I don't really want to recommend you the other places in %uh Geylang area because %uh I think it's not so convenient.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe a little bit more in terms of your budget %um. Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's one at Chinatown, the Inn At Temple Street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and that's another one at Victoria Street about a hundred and thirty dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh they are quite conveniently located where you can take the public transport to your- the places of interest.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so for your son, I would like to recommend- does he like animals?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, he likes animals and %uh he loves to play outside %um.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would like to recommend %um the zoo for him.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the zoo is located in the northern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh what he can see in the zoo would be %uh all the %uh mammals, a lot of mammals.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh like the orang-utan.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um in %um for example I will take the hotel you say about a while ago.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh is that near from the zoo?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh sorry, what do you say?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um if I will pick a hotel-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: A bus?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you say a bus?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it %uh near in means of %um public transportation.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what is the best way to go to the zoo from the hotel that %uh you %uh refer for me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From the hotels that I recommended-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh you can always go to the City Hall MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At the MRT, it's a subway.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you take the North Line towards Ang Mo Kio Station and from Ang Mo Kio, you change a bus- a public bus.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh bus number one three eight.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um and it-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you know how to take the public transport?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I don't have any idea.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please %uh elaborate that for me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For the MRT, you pay according to the distance travelled.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you will buy a ticket.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh when you arrived at the station %uh in- within the busy areas like the vicinity of the City Hall area to the Orchard Area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the MRT runs beneath the road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you go down to the basement area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there would be a ticket machine.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you will have to carry some Singapore money with you if you want to take our public transport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you just %uh press a button to tell you the- to tell the computer %uh the machine which station are you going to alight.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the machine will tell you how much money %uh the fare will be.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how %um- for example I'm carrying a %uh dollar %um for my currency.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What would be the recommended %uh currency when I were- when I was there in the Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well %uh I would recommend you to change some Singapore money.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you are going to take %uh public transport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in case you want to buy some street food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I would recommend that you change %um money into Singapore money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can I ask %uh what will be the change- %uh foreign exchange %uh from dollar to Singaporean Dollar?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh are you talking about US Dollars?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, from US Dollars to Singapore Dollars %uh the rate now is approximately about one Singapore Dollars will give you approximately %uh a dollar %uh twenty seven cents US %uh- sorry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh one US Dollar would give you approximately about a one dollar twenty seven cents-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm oh %hm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Singapore money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh can I ask %uh if I will go there by the mid of April do you have any festivals %uh during that date?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh if I can %um saw- see what- how festivals in Singapore and compare it from here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for the period of April, we do not have any major festivals coming up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If ever %uh what would be the %uh best festival?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if I have %uh next time visit I will go during that %uh those months.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the- I would say- well it's very festive and a lot of people %uh are very busy preparing for the festival.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would say it %uh will be among our major festival like Chinese New Year sometime in January

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh period the- %uh preparation before %uh the actual festival.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And also the %uh festival that's celebrated by the Malays will be Hari Raya.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And also Deepavali in November.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh Christmas time in December.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I have put on the screen our public holidays calendar for this year.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Chinese New Year is over now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it was celebrated on the twenty third and twenty fourth.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the whole month of January was very busy in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh May, we have Vesak Day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no major preparation before Vesak Day.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the next %uh major festival would be Hari Raya in August.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And Deepavali in the month of November.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this will be more %um- I would say the major festival where you will see a lot more preparation %um and a very carnival festive mood %uh just before this public holidays.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also can I add %um I- if I'm a nature lover %um if there's any %uh tourist spots that you will recommend to me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh nature as in plants or in birds or fishes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think %um-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or coral- I mean %uh marine life?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh plants  or %uh looks like %um a park or anythings that I can see some natures.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: See some nature.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well I would like to recommend you this %uh hill which is at- a very popular hill in Singapore, for the local as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We call it the Bukit Timah Nature Reserve.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is our tallest hill in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you can see some pictures now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and in fact our Bukit Timah Nature Reserve has one of the %um- a lot of %uh flora and fauna as you climb up the hill.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But as- if you are too tired, you can always turn around and there will be some small animals that you will see along the way.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there any %um-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is the Bukit Timah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can I ask is there any %um %uh entrance fee or a fee that we- I have to pay before entering that %uh Reserve- Nature Reserve?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's no entrance fee %um and it would be better if you either go in the morning or the evening.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there any %uh particular rules that should I %um follow when-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well of course %uh dress comfortably, good walking shoes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh bring water with you and also hat with you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course do not wander off the normal trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That means if there's no trail, do not walk on those trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So just do the normal walkway and there are also walking trail, there will be signs that this is a walking trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do not wander off the normal walking trail and you will be fine.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there %eh oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is %uh quite a popular hill.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there will be- usually %uh some people that you will meet along the way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just not like so quiet that you don't see anybody at all.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um is there %uh there is an %uh restaurant or a- some food chain %uh even %uh for example we don't want to carry some loads to bring us there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there any restaurant %uh when we %uh so we can eat there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, for the Bukit Nature Reserve Park %uh we don't have any %uh restaurants out there but just across the road %uh there are quite a few eating places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So when you alight %uh when you climb down from the tree- %uh from the hill, just go across the road and there will be quite a lot of eating places out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh restaurants as well as non-air conditioned %uh we call it coffee shops.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh anything else-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So maybe- Yes, so maybe at the same time if you're going to climb %uh Bukit Timah you can also bring along some snacks with you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just also %uh be careful, don't put your food items in plastic bag.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Put them inside your bag because %uh there will be some monkeys on the hill.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they will think that, you know, your plastic bag would have contained food and they may %um disturb you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how about %uh anything else that %um where we can go %uh for visit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I mentioned earlier on %uh I would like to recommend the zoo-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for your %uh child because %uh our zoo is very nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it- %uh the animals are not keep- are not kept in %uh cages.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's an open zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: He will get to see or you will get to see elephants, orang-utans.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in fact Singapore Zoo has the largest collection of orang-utan.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm showing you the- %uh okay, I will show you the %uh attractions-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh that can be found in the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think this will interest him, the polar bear.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I have a- just limited time to visit %uh Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's about for one or to two days.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh for one day, I can travel around to- around Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I mean for %uh do-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can I %um- I will visit every %eh tourist spots in Singapore within a day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well I would say that you have to be selective.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have so many things to see in Singapore so if it's just a one day programme-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: then you can do a three hours tour of the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can do at morning, the Bukit Timah Hill and have a lunch in %uh one of our local non-air conditioned to the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And in lunch time, you can actually do a relaxing river cruise on the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so I will just show you %uh the river cruise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just a short ride on the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that will be something quite relaxing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And after your river cruise, you could have a dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, you can see the boat now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: On this kind of river cruise, it's about a half an hour cruise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you could alight at the- this is the %uh the Clarke Quay area or Boat Quay area and have a nice dinner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For how much %uh for a ride in the cruise?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The cruise will cost you fifteen dollars for an adult.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And for your child, it will be eight dollars Singapore money.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh for the cruise, it includes the food?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. On the cruise itself, there's no food provided.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just a cruise on the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's just half an hour ride.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And there will be a commentary %uh on the cruise itself to tell you what you are looking at on the left and right-hand side of the %uh places that you're going to pass by.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The cruise- yes, this is the cruise that I'm talking about.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's a Chinese looking kind of a boat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And %uh can you give some %uh examples that you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The places where I can see like in- during that cruise.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Which one will be the highlight of the cruise?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The cruise like I mentioned is only a half an hour ride.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you will pass by some of the highlight, the financial district area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so you see a lot of skyscrapers.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you will see %uh bridges.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, old bridges in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you will also get to see %uh- you will also get to see %uh the old warehouses.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and of course the icon of Singapore, the Merlion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So on- this is what you are going to see %uh on the cruise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's just a short cruise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you look on the right-hand side %uh can you see the blue shaded area?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, this is actually the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you will be travelling out this way, out to the Marina Bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now I'm gonna just show you this picture here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, now, you can see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the boat that's going to %uh travel on the Singapore River, you're going to see %uh this scene.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh now, the houses that's yellow in colour %uh that is actually Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm saying that when the boat gets stopped back, you can go for a dinner, a nice dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Whether you choose to have a fine dining or casual place cafe there are all %uh kind of food there including Spanish, Mexican, Indian Chinese, seafood, barbecue.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They're all found there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can walk around and choose a restaurant that you like.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is what you're going to see %uh on the cruise itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh of course they- when you come out of the bay, you will see the Merlion %uh icon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh for- in terms of communication, what are- what would be the preferred language if there, you know.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our language of administration here is English so our street sign %uh will be English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: All our documents will be English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The menu %um given to you by the restaurants will also be written in English.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: All service staff will be speaking English.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, that's nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um anything else in Si- in the package %uh so where we can- where can I go?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for one day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay this is the programme that I would say %uh it has something for your son to do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As well as %uh a little bit of relaxing cruise in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But of course there are lots of other things that you can do in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For example, we have Universal Studio in Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you could also do that instead of doing the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um in the afternoon, you could go over to Sentosa and do Universal Studio in the afternoon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what we- %uh what I'm-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: what will be the highlights there in Universal Studio?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The highlight, I think %uh that will be different.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are other %uh Stu- %uh Universal Studios do not have would be the latest ride, it's called Transformer.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is quite an exciting ride %uh for you and your son.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, this is the ride that I'm talking about.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are seven zones %uh to explore in Universal %uh Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see there's Hollywood, New York, Sci-Fi, Ancient Egypt and Lost World and Far Far Away and Madagascar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the seven zone %uh that you can visit in Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can see all these are the scene %uh street scene of Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are lots of rides there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there any particular %uh museums where we can go in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for both your son and yourself or more for your son?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For %hm- Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: More for your son?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would %uh recommend to you %uh to bring him to the Science Centre in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's %um- it will be suitable for a young %uh person.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is there an entran-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and- yes?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh on- is there an entrance fee?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, the admission charges %uh for the Science Centre %uh would be-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: nine dollars for an adult and five dollars for the children- for the child.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it is located in the Western part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you need me to give you direction how to get there?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes please.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now %um I will always come back to City Hall MRT-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: because this is one of our interchange.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh it's the interchange between the East and the West Line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so because we have not chosen the hotel yet, so I will just- for reference, go back to City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From City Hall, you take the West Line and you alight at Jurong East MRT Train Station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From there when you come out, you will just walk about ten minutes and you get to the Singapore Science Centre.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, okay, thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um do you have any %uh beaches in there in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what do you say?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we do have beach on the mainland.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but it is- it will be just a simple beach.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh- yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you- Can you please %uh show me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I will show you the %uh beaches in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is in the East Coast so it's just a simple beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a little bit rocky over in the %uh East Coast and also the Changi Beach %uh of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it open for the public?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you want to go there for swimming or- is it for swimming?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh for swimming, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I like swimming, yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well, the Changi Beach and the East Coast Beach %um will not be fine sand.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, it's a little bit rocky.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The sand is a little bit %um coarse.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh on Saturdays afternoon and Sundays afternoon, the- you will see more local people going there for swimming.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise we have %uh better beaches over on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like %uh Palawan as well as %uh Siloso Beach over on the Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, thank you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh anything else you can add with aside from some- those tourist spots that you have given to me?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay, if you intend to extend your holidays in Singapore, of course like I said there's a lot more things to do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh now, I'm actually showing you a map of Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But for one day %uh you really have to be very selective so we do have other museums in Singapore or like the National Museum which highlights the %uh history of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh arts Museum %uh where you see contemporary art.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um war Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if your son is interested %uh to know a little bit about the war because Singapore was occupied by the Japanese.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we do have quite a few war museums as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um so for visits to museum, well, depending on how big the museum is.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Minimum one to three hours, alright, would be sufficient.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh for a tourist %uh what would be the maximum days that will give- the immigration will give for a tourist.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh normally for immigration, we give a one month %uh visitor pass.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you seems to be concerned about some rules and regulation with Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please %uh tell me something about it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like I said %uh we do not encourage littering.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh so if you does any litter, please throw them into the %uh litter bins, the rubbish bin.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for lighting of %uh cigarette, there are quite a few restriction now including the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %um in short, very simple, anything that's indoor, in the restaurants, yes, we do not allow %uh cigarettes to be lighted up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh including bus stop.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there must be %uh- like an area %uh from the- enclosed area that you can do %uh light up of cigarettes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think these are the major concern otherwise %uh crime rate here is pretty low.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you are able to move around quite freely even in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: As usual just avoid all the dark lanes %um and do not carry too much cash with you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that then you will be having a very enjoyable time in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay, so %uh. Okay, thank you for that informations.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um %uh about %uh %um I've heard that %uh you have a Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please %uh tell me something about it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the Night Safari opens in the night time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: From seven thirty to eight o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again it is an open Night Safari, you won't see cages in this Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It is just next door to the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so if your son is really into animals, you could do the afternoon zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At night, you could bring him over just next door to the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now if you look at the first picture.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh this is a tram that brings you around the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that you are not too tired.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You don' have to walk the entire park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And on this two tram ride itself, of course you see about seventy per cent of the animals.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It will be different from what you see in the zoo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see the leopards here, the Malayan tapir, the fishing cat.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you are not too tired, you can do a walk- short walk in the middle of the tram ride, there is- the tram will stop, you can do a walking trail towards the leopard area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh that will take you about forty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Half an hour to forty minutes and you go back to the tram station and board back the next tram.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That will bring you back to the entrance area and you can do another walking trail called the Fishing Cat Trail.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh %hm.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- and if you are not too tired again, there is a Forest Giant Trail.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Again, from the entrance area that you can walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, Fishing Cat Trail, about twenty minutes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you want to see some shows, we do have two shows in the Night Safari.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but usually there's a long queue to see the Creatures of the Night show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is a show. It's a-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is a show. It's a- just a twenty minute show- thirty minute show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they will bring in some animals %uh the smaller animals %uh for the audience to look at.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm and how about the admission fee, how much is that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much is that?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the admission fee for the Night Safari will be thirty two dollars for the adult.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the child will be twenty one dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think it's nice.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um that one is good for my child.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I also heard that there is a %um Ocean Park %uh- do I %um- do you have an Ocean Park there in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we call our %uh ocean park, the Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And this is located in %um Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you please %uh show me some datas ab- show our datas- some datas about that %um Underworld.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, the Underworld is located on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm now flashing you some of the photographs taken in the Underwater world.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now over here %uh the highlight would be- you go into the basement area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You step on the travelator and you were actually in an underground %uh tank, a very big tank.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So inside the travelator, you will get to see sharks, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Stingray and lots of other kinds of fishes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh in this Underwater World, you don't have to walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, the travelator will bring you around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can really get to see a lot of %uh marine life when you're in this %uh travelator.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now besides this travelator, if you look at the bottom right-hand corner.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are what we call mimicry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You see this %uh yellow colour looking marine life?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now it's on the screen now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Now if this marine- cry- %uh marine %uh sea creature, it's among the seaweeds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can really miss this marine %uh sea creature.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, they actually looks like a seaweed or a plant.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's looks like a seahorse weed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But actually if it's among the plant, you can't even miss this %um %uh sea creature.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so these are just some of the sea marine life that you would see in the Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But this is on Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you're going to choose Sentosa, then you can do the beach, the Underwater World and the Universal Studio all in one day because they're in the same location.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I see.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I have %uh last more concern about.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For example %uh I have %uh given for one or to two days.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh I have- I want to extend %uh my stay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh what should I do %uh to extend?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh do I need to go to Immigration or- to extend the date?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. Because when you come in to Singapore, our immigration officers %uh would normally give you a one month stay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there's no need to extend it %uh your stay in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But do check on your passport, you know, what is the validity that's given to you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I would say normally one month.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh if I exceeded one month, what-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you forgot, alright %uh to see what is your length of stay in Singapore and you overstayed in Singapore, then please bring your passport and yourself to our immigration office in Lavender %uh Street.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, we have an immigration %uh office there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And tell them %uh your situation.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think I have %uh all the information that I needed.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um anything else you want to add %um-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For- if you intend to visit the Universal Studio, I will recommend that you book your tickets online first just in case, you know, that day happens to be a very crowded day because we do have a limit %uh as in %uh visitors %uh going into the Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh how much for the admission fee?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh to the Universal Studio, for the adult on a weekday, it will be sixty eight dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh weekends, public holidays, will be seventy four dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For the child, it will be fifty dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And weekend will be %uh fifty four %uh dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh also for %uh certain rides in the Universal Studio, there's a height limit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh for certain rides like roller coaster, the child would be have- %uh to be approximately about %uh one point two %uh metres tall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, for certain rides in the park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: okay, thank you very much for that %uh- for helping me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um that's all.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I hope you will- you know %uh visit us soon.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I will.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Welcome.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Bye.
